page.title: 09Wolverhampton's Newspaper
page.content: Established from small beginnings the Express & Star has become the largest regional evening newspaper sold in the United Kingdom. This medium has developed rapidly into a widespread group with interests as diverse as computer systems,politics, contract colour printing monthly colour magazines and free newspapers covering Uttoxeter,Bromsgrove,Birmingham,Bewdley and Shropshire. In 1964 after the announcement of a new Shropshire town,Telford,the Group decided to launch the first post war period evening paper.Many surveys have resulted in a large amount of local and national information being available to customers.All of this only gives a brief indication of why the Express & Star claims to be the Number One for the Midlands.
